translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
Fifth Section
Misapprehension

analyzed: pathavī kasiṇam samāpattim samāpannassa viparīte ñāṇanti
translated: “Is there knowledge of the opposite in one who has attained the earth-kasiṇa attainment?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: anicce niccanti vipariyeso ti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “Is there misapprehension of the impermanent as permanent?”🔽“No.” …
“Is there misapprehension of the painful as pleasant …
of the not-self as self …
of the ugly as beautiful?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …

analyzed: pathavī kasiṇam samāpattim samāpannassa viparīte ñāṇanti
translated: “Is there knowledge of the opposite in one who has attained the earth-kasiṇa attainment?”
“Yes.”
“Is it unprofitable?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is it profitable?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci kusalaṁ, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci kusala no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.”

analyzed: pathavī kasiṇam samāpattim samāpannassa viparīte ñāṇanti
translated: “Then it is not right to say that there is knowledge of the opposite in one who has attained the earth-kasiṇa attainment.”

original: Anicce niccanti vipariyeso, so ca akusaloti?
analyzed: anicce niccanti vipariyeso so ca akusalo ti
translated: “Is there misapprehension of the impermanent as permanent, and is it unprofitable?”
“Yes.”

original: Pathavīkasiṇaṁ samāpattiṁ samāpannassa viparīte ñāṇaṁ, tañca akusalanti?
analyzed: pathavī kasiṇam samāpattim samāpannassa viparīte tat ca akusalanti
translated: “Is there knowledge of the opposite in one who has attained the earth-kasiṇa attainment, and is it unprofitable?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is there misapprehension of the painful as pleasant …
of the not-self as self …

original: asubhe subhanti vipariyeso, so ca akusaloti?
analyzed: asubhe subhanti vipariyeso saḥ ca akusalo ti
translated: Is the perversion that what is foul is fair unskillful?
You have said enough.

original: Pathavīkasiṇaṁ samāpattiṁ samāpannassa viparīte ñāṇaṁ, tañca akusalanti?
analyzed: pathavī kasiṇam samāpattim samāpannassa viparīte tat ca akusalanti
translated: Is the knowledge of one who has attained the earth-kasiṇa attainment a perversion, and is it unskillful?
You have said enough.

original: Pathavīkasiṇaṁ samāpattiṁ samāpannassa viparīte ñāṇaṁ, tañca akusalanti?
analyzed: pathavī kasiṇam samāpattim samāpannassa viparīte tat ca akusalanti
translated: Is the perversion that what is impermanent is permanent skillful?

original: Āmantā.🔽Anicce niccanti vipariyeso, so ca kusaloti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…
analyzed: āmantā  anicce niccanti vipariyeso so ca kusalo ti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: You have said enough.

original: pathavīkasiṇaṁ samāpattiṁ samāpannassa viparīte ñāṇaṁ, tañca akusalanti?
analyzed: pathavī kasiṇam samāpattim samāpannassa viparīte tat ca akusalanti
translated: Is the knowledge of one who has attained the earth-kasiṇa attainment a perversion, and is it unskillful?
You have said enough.
Is the perversion that what is painful is pleasant …
that what is not self is a self …

original: asubhe subhanti vipariyeso, so ca kusaloti?
analyzed: asubhe subhanti vipariyeso saḥ ca kusalaḥ ti
translated: that what is foul is fair skillful?
You have said enough.

analyzed: pathavī kasiṇam samāpattim samāpannassa viparīte ñāṇanti
translated: Is the knowledge of one who has attained the earth-kasiṇa attainment a perversion?
You have said enough.

analyzed: arahā pathavī kasiṇam samāpattim samāpajjeyya iti
translated: Is it possible for a perfected one to attain the earth-kasiṇa attainment?
You have said enough.

original: Hañci arahā pathavīkasiṇaṁ samāpattiṁ samāpajjeyya, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci arahā pathavī kasiṇam samāpattim samāpajjeyya no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Is it the case that a perfected one attains the earth-kasiṇa attainment, and yet you say that it is not proper to say that

analyzed: pathavī kasiṇam samāpattim samāpannassa viparīte ñāṇanti
translated: “The knowledge of one who has attained the earth kasiṇa.”

original: Pathavīkasiṇaṁ samāpattiṁ samāpannassa viparīte ñāṇaṁ, arahā pathavīkasiṇaṁ samāpattiṁ samāpajjeyyāti?
analyzed: pathavī kasiṇam samāpattim samāpannassa viparīte ñāṇa arahā pathavī kasiṇam samāpattim samāpajjeyya ati
translated: Is it possible that a perfected one would attain the earth kasiṇa?
“Yes.”
“Does a perfected one have perversions?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …
“Does a perfected one have perversions?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: atthi arahato saññā vipariyeso citta vipariyeso diṭṭhi vipariyeso
translated: “Does a perfected one have perversions of perception, of thought, or of view?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the eye-consciousness element?” …

analyzed: natthi arahato saññā vipariyeso citta vipariyeso diṭṭhi vipariyeso
translated: “Does a perfected one not have perversions of perception, of thought, or of view?”
“Yes.”

original: Hañci natthi arahato saññāvipariyeso cittavipariyeso diṭṭhivipariyeso, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci natthi arahato saññā vipariyeso citta vipariyeso diṭṭhi vipariyeso no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “So a perfected one does not have perversions of perception, of thought, or of view, and yet you said ‘Yes’ when asked whether a perfected one has perversions.

analyzed: atthi arahataḥ vipariyeso ti  na vattabba
translated: You can’t have it both ways.”

analyzed: pathavī kasiṇam samāpattim samāpannassa viparīte ñāṇanti
translated: “Is it true that you said that the knowledge of one who has attained the earth kasiṇa is perverted?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: pathavī kasiṇam samāpattim samāpajjantassa sabbā iva pathavī ti
translated: “When entering the earth kasiṇa, is everything earth?”
“Then is it that the Blessed One has not taught the Dhamma?” “One should not say so.”

original: Tena hi pathavīkasiṇaṁ samāpattiṁ samāpannassa viparīte ñāṇanti.
analyzed: tena hi pathavī kasiṇam samāpattim samāpannassa viparīte ñāṇanti
translated: “Then it’s not the case that one who has attained the earth kasiṇa has knowledge of what is upside-down.”

analyzed: pathavī kasiṇam samāpattim samāpannassa viparīte ñāṇanti
translated: “Does one who has attained the earth kasiṇa have knowledge of what is upside-down?”
“Yes.”

original: Nanu pathavī atthi, atthi ca koci pathaviṁ pathavito samāpajjatīti?
analyzed: nanu pathavī atthi atthi ca koci pathavim pathavitaḥ samāpajjati iti
translated: “But doesn’t earth exist, and does someone enter the earth kasiṇa attainment by way of earth?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci pathavī atthi, atthi ca koci pathaviṁ pathavito samāpajjati, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci pathavī atthi atthi ca koci pathavim pathavitaḥ samāpajjati no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.”

analyzed: pathavī kasiṇam samāpattim samāpannassa viparīte ñāṇanti
translated: “Then it’s surely the case that one who has attained the earth kasiṇa has knowledge of what is upside-down.”

original: Pathavī atthi, pathaviṁ pathavito samāpajjantassa viparītaṁ hotīti?
analyzed: pathavī atthi pathavim pathavitaḥ samāpajjantassa viparītam hoti iti
translated: “Does earth exist, and is it upside-down for one who has attained the earth kasiṇa?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Nibbānaṁ atthi, nibbānaṁ nibbānato samāpajjantassa viparītaṁ hotīti?
analyzed: āmantā  nibbānam atthi nibbānam nibbānataḥ samāpajjantassa viparītam hoti iti
translated: “Yes.”

original: Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…🔽tena hi na vattabbaṁ—
analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  tena hi na vattabba
translated: “But doesn’t Nibbāna exist, and is Nibbāna upside-down for one who has attained the Nibbāna kasiṇa?”🔽“No.”

analyzed: pathavī kasiṇam samāpattim samāpannassa viparīte ñāṇanti
translated: “Then you should not say that one who has attained the earth kasiṇa has knowledge of what is upside-down.”
The discussion of what is upside-down is finished.
